alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 8:20PM EST until January 05 at 3:09PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Lewis and Mason. In Ohio, Adams and Brown. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 819 PM EST, local law enforcement reported lingering high water on some area roadways. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Maysville, Washington, West Union, Manchester, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Lewisburg, Tollesboro, Rome, Concord, Ribolt, Herron Hill, Trinity, Rectorville, Epworth, Orangeburg, Glen Springs, Bradysville and Charters.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
